Mamta Taruni Abhiyan.details: Launched by the Directorate of Women and Child Development, this scheme provides free medical check-ups, iron and folic acid supplements, deworming medication, and cash incentives to adolescent girls (10-19 years) and pregnant women, particularly from Below Poverty Line (BPL) families.
benefits: Cash incentive of ₹6,000 for pregnant women
application_process: Register through local Anganwadi centers or ASHA workers
Submit necessary documents (ID proof, medical certificate, bank details, income certificate, address proof)
Participate in health check-up sessions

Mukhyamantri Free Diagnostic Scheme.details: Introduced with a corpus of ₹110 crore, this scheme aims to provide free-of-cost diagnostic services in all government health institutions and empanelled laboratories for Economically Weaker Section (EWS) households.
benefits: Available in government health institutions and empanelled laboratories
eligibility: EWS households as per government criteria
application_process: Visit the nearest government health institution or empanelled laboratory
Present valid ID proof and address proof
Undergo prescribed diagnostic tests

Ayushman Bharat – Pradhan Mantri Jan Aro.details: A national health protection scheme providing a cover of ₹5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization. The Gujarat government has doubled this cap to ₹10 lakh per family, ensuring free-of-cost medical treatment.
benefits: Health cover up to ₹10 lakh per family
Free-of-cost medical treatment for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization
eligibility: Families identified under the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) criteria
application_process: Check eligibility through the official PMJAY portal
Register at empanelled hospitals or Common Service Centers (CSCs)
Receive Ayushman Bharat card for availing benefits

Health and Wellness Centres (HWCs).details: Under the National Health Mission, Gujarat is establishing Health and Wellness Centres to provide Comprehensive Primary Health Care (CPHC) services, including maternal and child health, non-communicable diseases, and mental health services.
eligibility: Services available at designated HWCs across the state
application_process: Visit the nearest Health and Wellness Centre
Register for services as per the guidelines
Receive necessary healthcare services

Palliative Care Implementation Plan (PCI.details: This plan aims to provide palliative care services to individuals with chronic illnesses, ensuring quality of life through pain and symptom management, psychological support, and end-of-life care.
application_process: Register through local health centers or hospitals
Undergo assessment by healthcare professionals
Receive palliative care services as per the plan

School Health Programme.details: Implemented since 1996-97, this programme conducts annual health check-ups for school children, aiming to identify health issues early and provide necessary interventions.
benefits: Annual health check-ups for school children
Referral to appropriate healthcare services if needed
eligibility: Enrolled in government or government-aided schools
application_process: Participate in the annual health check-up sessions organized by schools
Receive necessary referrals or treatments as identified

Ayushman Arogya Yojana.details: A state-specific scheme providing financial assistance for medical treatments, aiming to reduce out-of-pocket expenditure and improve access to healthcare services.
benefits: Coverage for various medical procedures and services
eligibility: Families meeting the eligibility criteria set by the state government
application_process: Apply through the official Arogya Sathi portal
Submit necessary documents for verification
Receive assistance as per the approved guidelines
